page.title: 18ROBIN HOOD:THE FACTS???
page.content: {"Robin o'th'woods"}was probably a general name for outlaws in the Middle Ages.This romanticised "mugger" first appears in{Wyntoun's Chronicle of {Scotland}in 1420.{The Lyttle Geste of {Robyn Hode}appeared from Caxton's Press in 1495."Lyttle Geste" located him in Yorkshire but later ballads and stories moved him to Nottinghamshire. {The True Tale of Robin Hood}in verse appeared in 1632 and had him dying on 18th November 1247. {Edwinstowe}is the{Sherwood Forest} village where{Robin Hood}is supposed to have married{Maid Marian}but Blidworth is another claimant.{Robin {Hood's larder}was a giant hollow oak tree which became dangerous and collapsed in 1962.{The Major Oak}was beloved by Major Rooke so The Queen Oak became "t'Major's Oak". { }
